node.display_long_description:
Become fully immersed in the firefight! Experience a first person shooter as you never have before: Onward combines mil-sim gameplay with the experience of playing in virtual reality. Players cannot rely on crosshairs or mini maps, instead you rely on coordination and communication with your squad in order to succeed at your objective. Realistic combat mechanics and artificial locomotion will push your combat survival skills to their limit as you engage in infantry combat across a large variety of maps and combat situations.

Onward features a wide variety of solo, coop and competitive game modes. Take to the online battlefield and join your friends in cross-platform combat in a high stakes clash with up to ten people and best your opponents on a strategic and tactical level in an Uplink or Assault match, chase down AI bots in a Hunt mission or wait for extraction as waves of enemies approach you during an Evac mission. The only way is Onward.

nodes.title: Onward 1.8.7 is available now!
nodes.body_text:
Hello everyone!

We are pleased to announce that the time for the 1.8.7 update is now! This update is primarily focused on audio upgrades and the re-release of the Snowpeak map, but also contains a lot of bug fixes and general improvements.

Our audio improvements comprise amongst many other things gunshots that are more consistent in their quality, more immersive and directional footsteps, higher quality voice chat, more immersive environmental sound, and more consistency between the volumes of different sources. Two new features for audio are the ability to independently adjust the volume of gunshots and voices, and audio mixing presets to select.

Enjoy those updated audio sounds while playing again on the re-released Snowpeak map (day and night versions available!) and hear the crunch of the snow under your feet as you tactically sneak around on the ice to get that perfect shot in as you notice the other team coming your way. Snowpeak features long distance engagement and close quarter combat options. This map will test your skills in stealth and tactical abilities.

Smoke grenades have also been reworked. They have changed to spherical from the previous comic spray to allow them to be used in a more predictable way which benefits gameplay. Full screen tint will be more accurately bound to the area of the smoke, and is harder to see through. We have also fixed an issue where AI wasn’t affected by smoke grenades and could ‘see’ players as usual. Finally and perhaps most importantly scopes no longer fully tint when looking at smoke grenades, allowing you to see players in front of the smoke through scopes once more.

Update 1.8.7 is available now and will download automatically. Enjoy!

node.reviewDescription:
i got this game as i get a large ish game every 6 months or so just to keep things interesting 

i remember when this game was “ coming soon” and everyone got all excited when it came out but as i remember it kinda died down quick so i assumed it was because it had issues and honestly it was probably because of the annoying fortnite playing 10-12 year olds that tend to plague anything remotely competitive 

but either way i got the game last week ish 

n i absolutely love it

it has such amazing attention to detail down to  bullets moving through the guns actions and iv had an absolute blast 

for once guns are actually relatively balanced along with the gear ( except maybe the smoke it’s kinda overly effective sometimes) but everything works just fine and actually runs really smooth for its complexity 

things like weapon priming and grenade safeguards and smoke colors and actually leaving your tablet or pistol or magazine behind and it not do that stupid “ magic teleport “ thing 

there’s no ammo count showing and i’m so so glad for that because dropping the mag of my rifle to physically check the rounds left makes it so immersive 

there’s no artificial jump or crouch so nobody can spam and sprinting isn’t overly fast so it’s not turned into a rec room game of run and gun and i’m so thankful for that 

iv met so many good people and had so many cool moments of organized operations carried out so beautifully and everyone working as a team 

i could literally go on and on about things like the radio and proximity chat or how you can hand guns and stuff to other people as they are actual objects but ill save u the time 

a game doesn’t need to have good graphics for it to be good and i say that especially to everyone who takes a game just for how it looks. think of old runescape. didn’t look amazing but was an amazing game. this is one of those. feels like the old late night CSGO games when i was younger add six siege and vr

it’s an absolutely amazing game and iv literally suggested it to my friends who don’t even have a headset 

get it 

try out the fireing ranch first then some fighting and i promise you won’t regret getting this game 

-Km
node.reviewTitle: don’t compare a milsim to a cod game

website_page_meta.description: Onward is a Mil-sim multiplayer first-person shooter built for virtual reality. Work closely with your team in the heat of battle and engage in the most realistic cross-platform combat experience available in gaming today.
website_page_meta.title: Onward · Oculus Quest
